properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a ListTemplate object to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application

properties.name: listLevels
properties.description: Gets a ListLevelCollection object that represents all the levels for the list template.

examples.description: Get all list levels from a list template and log the count of available levels to the console.

properties.name: outlineNumbered
properties.description: Specifies whether the list template is outline numbered.

examples.description: Check if a list template is outline numbered and display the result in the console.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

examples.description: Load and display the level count property of the first list template in the document

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

examples.description: Configure multiple properties of a list template at once, including its bullet character and font settings for the first level.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.ListTemplate object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ListTemplateData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a list template to JSON format for logging or data transfer purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to

examples.description: Track a list template object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls when modifying list properties in different batches
